briefdescription.para: set when the first Component is created, see remarks @ Component ctor
refers to components in the ui hierarchy that are top most

world space components collision shape is always relevant to a Mesh; but they are still rendered in screen space and as such always facing the camera, eg. "character health bar" is considered world space component
the component, excluding root, that was last hovered - updated on on_hover_off()
the component, excluding root, that is currently being hovered - updated on evaluate_current_hover()
set on update() by root
set on update() by root
set on update() by root
Components with smaller depth numbers will render on top.
root component is an imaginary component and is always invisible
a tooltip Component will be created as a child of this one
the parent Component of the root is nullptr
tooltips do not exist in the main tree hierarchy, but are owned and managed by the individual components they exist in
this component's children, all events are passed down the hierarchy to children

memberdef.argsstring: (Graphics &gfx, const std::string &name, const std::variant< Component *, std::string > parent, const int x, const int y, const int width, const int height, const bool is_tooltip=false, const std::vector< std::pair< std::string, std::string > > &state_texts={}, const std::vector< std::pair< std::string, std::string > > &state_image_paths={}, const DirectX::XMVECTORF32 &text_color=DirectX::Colors::White, const DirectX::XMFLOAT2 &text_scale=DirectX::XMFLOAT2{1.0f, 1.0f}, const std::string &tooltip_text="", Mesh *mesh=nullptr, const bool is_interactive=true, const bool is_enabled=false, const bool visible=true, const bool update_when_not_visible=false, const Aspect_Ratio_Locked_Behavior aspect_ratio_locked_behavior=Aspect_Ratio_Locked_Behavior::Aspect_Ratio_None, const Dock_Point docking=Dock_Point::Dock_Point_None, const Text_Justification text_justification=Text_Justification::Text_Justification_Left)
memberdef.name: create_component

briefdescription.para: use this function to create a Component as a child of an existing parent Component

detaileddescription.para: the root Component must already be constructed using the class ctor
this function must have all the arguments and in the same order as the class ctor
width & height will be automatically generarated for image components

briefdescription.para: render ui components positioned in relevance to a mesh in 3d space
draws top most objects after rest of ui has been drawn (2d components, tooltips, WS components etc.)

memberdef.argsstring: (Graphics &gfx, const std::string &name, const std::variant< Component *, std::string > parent, const int x, const int y, const int width, const int height, const bool is_tooltip=false, const std::vector< std::pair< std::string, std::string > > &state_texts={}, const std::vector< std::pair< std::string, std::string > > &state_image_paths={}, const DirectX::XMVECTORF32 &text_color=DirectX::Colors::White, const DirectX::XMFLOAT2 &text_scale=DirectX::XMFLOAT2{1.0f, 1.0f}, const std::string &tooltip_text="", Mesh *mesh=nullptr, const bool is_interactive=true, const bool is_enabled=false, const bool visible=true, const bool update_when_not_visible=false, const Aspect_Ratio_Locked_Behavior aspect_ratio_locked_behavior=Aspect_Ratio_Locked_Behavior::Aspect_Ratio_None, const Dock_Point docking=Dock_Point::Dock_Point_None, const Text_Justification text_justification=Text_Justification::Text_Justification_Left)
memberdef.name: Component

briefdescription.para: you must supply either a non "" text, or an <component_state_str, image_path_str> argument

detaileddescription.para: aside from the root all new Components should be created using the static function create_component by specifying the parent Component of the to-be-created-Component
